Mehrauli, Seth Sarai, Mehrauli, New Delhi, Delhi 110030
Mathura Road, Opposite Dargah Nizamuddin, Nizamuddin, Nizamuddin East, New Delhi, Delhi 110013
Balmiki Basti, Vikram Nagar, Vikram Nagar, New Delhi, Delhi 110002
The Red Fort is probably Delhi\'s most iconic location. Built in 1639 by the very industrious and powerful Shah Jahan, who went on to build the Taj Mahal.
Qutub Minar is a massive intricately-carved stone edifice erected over a period of several hundred years, beginning in 1192 by Qutab-Ud-Din-Aibak, founder of the Muslim Delhi Sultanate.

Equally as impressive and more colorful than the Taj Mahal several hours to the south is the sprawling Humayan\'s Tomb, built in 1569-70 by Mughal emperor Nasir-ud-Din Muá¸¥ammad for his wife Bega Begum. The grounds are host to a number of other tombs that are as equally as impressive.

Feroz Shah Kotla is a citadel/city (Ferozabad) that formed part of early Delhi, and was erected by the Muslim Delhi Sultan Feroz Shah Tughlaq in 1354. One of the curious attractions available at this site is the Topra Ashokan Pillar, one of the few scattered around India. The Ashokan pillars are inscriptions by various kings encouraging kingdom citizens and future generations in moral, just, and righteous behaviour.
A-89-90, IGNOU Road, Neb Sarai, Freedom Fighter Colony, Block B, Neb Sarai, Sainik Farm, New Delhi, Delhi 110068, India
IGNOU Road and Gali No. 3, Neb Sarai, New Delhi, Delhi 110068
H-30, Middle Cir, Block H, Connaught Place, New Delhi, Delhi 110001, India
Lodhi Road, Opp. Mausam Bhavan, Lodhi Gardens, Lodhi Estate, New Delhi, Delhi 110003, India
North Indian, South Indian, and Chinese cuisine.

The best samosas and jalebi, made fresh in Delhi. Gupta is there during these hours, but samosas start selling at 5 pm on the button. Given him a few minutes to pray and thank God for the sales of the samosas and jelabi, then the fun begins!
The Chai Story is a European-style cafe serving a good variety of chais, cold teas, mojitos, and food. The pasta and pizza are highly recommended.

If high-end European and other world-wide food is your style, try the Garden Restaurant. This is situated adjacent the Lodi Gardens in the prestigious and beautiful Jor Bagh area, and has amazing food in a quiet and peaceful setting.
Federation of Railway Officer\'s Association Office, 256-A, Rail Bhavan, Raisina Road, New Delhi 110001
E3/8, Block E 3, Jhandewalan Extension, Jhandewalan, New Delhi, Delhi 110005, India
Siroya Centre, Sahar Airport Road, Andheri (East), Mumbai - 400099, India.

Quintessential travel in India. To not have at least one train experience in India would be almost missing the whole point. Leaving always on time but rarely arriving as intended, the journey is nonetheless the preferred means of travel: No traffic. No horns. No jackhammers. No potholes. No sudden stops and starts.

Almost as iconic as the Indian Railways, a trip to Delhi is incomplete without at least one ride on Gupta\'s rickshaw. These guys are very cheap, they know the best routes, and can maneuver through gnarly traffic relatively effortlessly. You will always want to tip these guys because they work extremely hard to get you to your destination.

Redbus has become the default booking app for bus transportation in India. You can get cheaper, local transportation at the bus stands, but this is a great way to ensure you have a ticket for your next departure or return.

Jet Airways is a home-grown low-cost Indian airline that flies through most major centers in India, and has a significant international presence as well, thanks to contracts with other major carriers.
Chandi Wali Gali, 916 Gali, Main Bazar Rd, Ratan Lal Market, Aram Bagh, Paharganj, New Delhi, Delhi 110055, India
Diplomatic Enclave, Africa Avenue, Chanakyapuri, New Delhi, Delhi 110023, India
Plot No. 1C, Sub District Centre, Hari Nagar, Hari Enclave, Hari Nagar, New Delhi, Delhi 110064, India
Jhandu Mansion, F 128, Mohammadpur, New Delhi, Delhi 110066, India
The Smyle Inn is a small backpacker hostel in the tourist area of Patparganj. It has a roof-top restaurant that serves a great breakfast and the staff are very friendly and helpful
A palatial five-star hotel in south Delhi that will definitely pamper you during your stay in Delhi.
Located in Nanak Pura in west Delhi, this typical upper-scale but simple hotel offers a complimentary breakfast with room booking.

Jugaad is a favourite Indian word more or less equivalent to the North American \'duct tape and baling wire\', meaning anything fixed probably has an element of innovation and \'this will hold for awhile\' attitude. Jugaad Hostels is a very pleasant and fun place for the backpacker crowd.
